Trash game trash Blizzard ruined whole overwatch 1 and soldier 76

With the introduction of battlepass, u can look at how the skins are subpar and decide not to spend 10$ on it. Which is a good thing I guess. But promising a brand new game only to deliver a skimmed version of original game and then asking 20-40$ for "PVE" bundles is kinda scummy. Also, overwatch was better.

ä½ ä¸ºå®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹æ•ˆåŠ›è¿™ä¹ˆå¤šå¹´ï¼Œä½ æŠŠä¸€åˆ‡éƒ½å¥‰çŒ®ç»™äº†ä»–ä»¬ï¼Œæœ€åå´è¢«èµ¶äº†å‡ºæ¥ï¼Œä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¿˜è¦å†å›å»ï¼Ÿä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¿˜è¦å†æˆ˜æ–—ï¼Ÿ
You worked for Overwatch for so many years, you gave everything to them, and then you got kicked out, so why go back? Why fight again?

OverwatchÂ® 2 is just a money pocket scheme of unbalanced changes and stupid updates that create some of the most toxic player vs player environments. While the game mechanics at core are simple characters are locked by stupid levels and challenges and are TIME consuming to do. TO unlock new supports,dps,tanks its 35 games per role of said new character. 

Then we have the Quality of LIFE changes, every season you question if the DEVS even play the game wondering WHY BUFF a character that is already strong but never touching characters like pocket mercy's etc game really takes a piece out of your mentality every single day. 

For any new players that read this please don't ever solo que NEVER. i have around 400-500 hours shared between 2 accounts and even then its not most compared to some of the other players who play, and within those hours i have learned that solo que just means losing a game sometimes your lucky sometimes its patients from Group homes or stage 4 cancer patients wanting to play at the end of the day i would NEVER recommend somebody solo que.

400 hrs on Battlenet

Blizzard has broken almost every promise they have ever made for Overwatch. Plagued by a total lack of innovation, the game has dealt with the same core issues since its launch in 2016. Not to mention the regular under-delivering on its most basic features, complete disregard for its player base, and abandoning the only thing that could bring back real interest in Overwatch, all for the sake of short-term profit.
